page.title: 13BAYSGARTH PARK
page.content: {Baysgarth House}was given to the town in 1930. Part of it is now used as the Council Chambers, the remainder serving as the town's museum. The grounds are the town's public park. They contain the new family leisure pool opened in 1984, 2 tennis courts, a bowling green and a children's play area. The major event held in the park is {Barton Carnival,}staged annually in July. A procession of decorated floats and people in fancy dress pass through the town, before assembling in the park to be judged. Throughout the afternoon there is live entertainment and a variety of stalls. Other annual events include a caravan rally, cross-country running championships and cyclo-cross. Since 1972 the park has been part of the{conservation area and contains 100 protected trees.
